article.title: How HISD’s Sunrise Centers are helping underserved students HOUSTON –
article.content:
How HISD’s Sunrise Centers are helping underserved students

HOUSTON – For many parents back to school can be a financial burden. Last school year the Houston Independent School District announced it was eliminating its wraparound services department, which helped families struggling to provide basic necessities to their children.

“[I was] worried, as were other parents in my situation; how are they going to do it?” said Maria Reynoso, who has a son in high school in HISD. “Economically everything’s getting high, but our paycheck is still the same amount.”

2 Investigates met Reynoso at HISD’s Sunrise Center set-up inside Mission Milby on Broadway in southeast Houston. She was picking up school supplies and clothes for her son.

SEE ALSO: Kinder Institute uses research to help HISD improve Sunrise Centers

Reynoso said the cost of ensuring her son has what he needs for school means making tough choices.

“I’m still trying to see if I’m not going to get evicted from my apartment,” said Reynoso.

“So, the choice is get everything your teenager needs or pay rent?” asked 2 investigates Robert Arnold.

“Yes, for me it’s get everything I need for school or pay rent?” said Reynoso.

In prior years, HISD’s wraparound services department would help struggling families connect with support services so their children could go to class and learn. Budget constraints and dwindling enrollment forced HISD to shutter this department.

However, the district opened seven Sunrise Centers in the fall of 2023. HISD partnered with the Houston Education Research Consortium (HERC), which is part of Rice University’s Kinder Institute, to determine where the Centers should be located and what services should be offered.


The centers offer food, clothes, educational support, healthcare, mental health support, help with transportation and a variety of other services.

Rice’s data shows 80-percent of HISD students are economically disadvantaged. HISD opened an eighth center this month at Marian Community Center on South Gessner in southwest Houston.

“We know that when kids aren’t well, or if they’re not being serviced with food or clothes, sometimes that adds to truancy, that they don’t go to school. So, this is a way to help that, support that, and then get the attendance up as well,” said HISD superintendent Mike Miles.

HISD’s data shows in the first year of operation the Centers served 30,900 families, and Rice’s data shows those who went to a Center showed a 33-percent improvement in attendance or behavior.

One of the differences between the centers and the now shuttered wraparound services department is they are in the community and families can walk-in without an appointment.

“It was hard to get an appointment at the school and up here you can just walk in, and then they can see you right there and then instead of trying to get an appointment,” said Reynoso.

Rice researchers point out it is easier to measure effectiveness at the Centers since student needs are in one place. Prior to the Centers, students and their families would go to a school and get a referral for support at different locations.

The Centers were set-up within existing community centers like Mission Milby, the YMCA or City of Houston facility. According to Rice, HISD is hoping to eventually expand to 12 Centers to reach all underserved communities identified by HERC.

“They do ask what school do your kids go to? And they, the people, that’s their work for HISD, so they know how to help you and what you’re needing for that certain grade,” said Reynoso.

Here are the locations of the HISD Sunrise Centers

summary:
# Résultat d’analyse

## Entités extraites
- **Langue** : en
- **Personnes** : Maria Reynoso, Robert Arnold, Mike Miles
- **Organisations** : Houston Independent School District, 2 Investigates, Mission Milby, Kinder Institute, Houston Education Research Consortium, Rice University, YMCA, City of Houston
- **Lieux** : HOUSTON, HISD, Mission Milby, Broadway, southeast Houston, Marian Community Center, South Gessner, southwest Houston
- **Dates** : 2023
- **Valeurs numériques** : 80-percent (80.0 %), eighth, 30,900 (30900.0 None), 33-percent (33.0 %), seven (7.0 None), 12 (12.0 None)

## Suggestions d’angles

### 1. Mapping Sunrise: Visualizing HISD's Community Impact
Create a geographic visualization of the Sunrise Centers in relation to underserved communities. Highlight the accessibility improvements and potential gaps in service coverage.

### 2. From Wraparound to Sunrise: A New Era in Student Support
Analyze the transition from HISD's wraparound services to the Sunrise Centers and their differing approaches. Evaluate how these changes have quantitatively impacted student attendance and behavior.

### 3. The Economics of Education: Cost-Saving Strategies for HISD Families
Examine how Sunrise Centers are alleviating financial burdens on families by providing essential services. Compare cost savings against local economic data to understand their broader economic impact.

### 4. Attendance and Behavior: Measuring Sunrise Centers' Success
Delve into the statistical improvements in attendance and behavior among students utilizing the centers. Explore the metrics used to evaluate these improvements and their implications for educational outcomes.

### 5. A Community-Driven Approach: The Role of Local Centers in Education
Investigate how integrating educational support within community hubs affects student and family engagement. Use case studies to illustrate the effectiveness of community-centered educational models.

angle_resources.title: Mapping Sunrise: Visualizing HISD's Community Impact
angle_resources.description: Create a geographic visualization of the Sunrise Centers in relation to underserved communities. Highlight the accessibility improvements and potential gaps in service coverage.

datasets.title: American Community Survey (ACS) Data
datasets.description: Provides detailed demographic, social, economic, and housing statistics for U.S. communities, useful for identifying underserved areas.

datasets.title: Open Data Portal for the City of Houston
datasets.description: Access datasets related to community services, including locations of public facilities and demographic information.

datasets.title: Health Resources and Services Administration Data
datasets.description: Explore data on health service areas, including Health Professional Shortage Areas (HPSA) and Medically Underserved Areas (MUA).

visualizations.title: Répartition géographique des Sunrise Centers
visualizations.note: Utiliser des données SIG pour représenter les centres sur une carte.

visualizations.title: Accessibilité des Sunrise Centers par communauté
visualizations.note: Les données de distance peuvent être calculées à partir des adresses des centres et des communautés.

visualizations.title: Comparaison des services offerts et des besoins communautaires
visualizations.note: Comparer les services disponibles dans les Sunrise Centers avec les besoins déclarés par les communautés.

angle_resources.title: From Wraparound to Sunrise: A New Era in Student Support
angle_resources.description: Analyze the transition from HISD's wraparound services to the Sunrise Centers and their differing approaches. Evaluate how these changes have quantitatively impacted student attendance and behavior.

datasets.title: National Center for Education Statistics (NCES) - School Safety and Discipline
datasets.description: Provides data on student attendance, behavior, and discipline across U.S. schools, useful for evaluating changes in student support services.

datasets.title: Texas Education Agency - Student Attendance Data
datasets.description: Offers detailed reports on student attendance metrics across Texas, including historical data that can be used to assess the impact of support service changes.

visualizations.title: Impact sur la fréquentation des élèves avant/après Sunrise
visualizations.note: Comparer les données de fréquentation avant et après l'introduction des Sunrise Centers.

visualizations.title: Comparaison du comportement des élèves : Wraparound vs Sunrise
visualizations.note: Données collectées sur les incidents disciplinaires annuels par type de service.

visualizations.title: Évolution des services Wraparound et Sunrise
visualizations.note: Visualisation de l'évolution des services offerts et de leur adoption par année.

angle_resources.title: The Economics of Education: Cost-Saving Strategies for HISD Families
angle_resources.description: Examine how Sunrise Centers are alleviating financial burdens on families by providing essential services. Compare cost savings against local economic data to understand their broader economic impact.

datasets.title: OECD Education at a Glance
datasets.description: Comprehensive data on the state of education systems, including financial aspects and economic impacts.

datasets.title: National Center for Education Statistics (NCES)
datasets.description: Data on U.S. education, including costs and economic impacts, useful for comparing local economic data.

datasets.title: U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA)
datasets.description: Economic data that can be used to compare cost savings and understand broader economic impacts.

visualizations.title: Cost Savings from Sunrise Centers vs Local Averages
visualizations.note: Compare average cost savings per service provided by Sunrise Centers against local market rates. Source: Local economic data and Sunrise Centers reports.

visualizations.title: Financial Impact of Sunrise Centers on HISD Families
visualizations.note: Visualize the proportion of income saved by different family income brackets due to services provided by Sunrise Centers. Source: HISD family income data and service usage reports.

visualizations.title: Broader Economic Impact of Sunrise Centers
visualizations.note: Analyze how the presence of Sunrise Centers correlates with changes in local economic indicators over time. Source: Local economic data and Sunrise Centers activity reports.

angle_resources.title: Attendance and Behavior: Measuring Sunrise Centers' Success
angle_resources.description: Delve into the statistical improvements in attendance and behavior among students utilizing the centers. Explore the metrics used to evaluate these improvements and their implications for educational outcomes.

datasets.title: OECD Education Statistics
datasets.description: Comprehensive data on educational outcomes, including attendance and student behavior metrics across OECD countries.

datasets.title: UNESCO Institute for Statistics - Education
datasets.description: Global education data including attendance rates and behavioral metrics, useful for evaluating educational outcomes.

visualizations.title: Amélioration de la fréquentation des Sunrise Centers
visualizations.note: Source : Données internes des Sunrise Centers, mises à jour mensuellement

visualizations.title: Comportement des étudiants avant et après l'utilisation des centres
visualizations.note: Comparaison des incidents avant et après l'inscription aux Sunrise Centers

visualizations.title: Corrélation entre fréquentation et résultats scolaires
visualizations.note: Analyse des résultats scolaires en fonction de la fréquentation des Sunrise Centers

angle_resources.description: Investigate how integrating educational support within community hubs affects student and family engagement. Use case studies to illustrate the effectiveness of community-centered educational models.

visualizations.note: Comparer différents types de centres communautaires; source : études de cas locales
